title.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Sept. 29, 1895. More Donations for St. Hedwig Parish Fair

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Sept. 29, 1895. MORE DONATIONS FOR ST. HEDWIG PARISH FAIR

body.p: The following contributions for the St. Hedwig Parish fair have been received by the Fair Committee:
Joseph Ornas: one canary and bird cage.
Marion Zielinska: cradle for doll and table set.
Andrew Zielinski: one canary and bird cage and three rabbits.
J. Ornas: six plates.
Anthony Dorez: one barrel of beer.
Alexander Kosznik: four boxes of cigars.
Boleslaw Hoffman: five dollars.
W. Osmanski: twelve boxes of cigars.
B. Rold and Son: twenty-five bottles of rum.
John Kosznik: five dollars.
Peter Binkowski: two dollars.
Wielewski: clothing.
Maries Brenk: four pictures.
R. : one silver pitcher and one canary.
: a violin valued at ten dollars.
Rose 5 of the Women'st Sodality of St. Hedwig Parish: $8.75.
Joseph Przedziankowski: seven pigeons.
Joseph Kamka: one canary and bird cage, and two money boxes.
Marion Kabaczynska: two ducks and two chickens.
Ignace Kabaczynski: one dollar.
Agatha Walezak: one dollar.
Michael Patke: one canary and bird cage.
Felix Recke: one canary and bird cage.
The young women of the St. Hedwig Parish Choir: a large beautiful doll dressed in velvet.
Vincent Roraj: one stove valued at thirteen dollars.
Rose 13 of the Women's Sodality of St. Hedwig Parish: five dollars.
Sincere thanks are extended to all kind donors.
